Types

TestContext = ref object of RootObj
  globs: seq[TestGlob]
  startTime: float
  sourceOnError: bool
  failCount: int
  lastSuite: Option[TestReport]
  lastTest: Option[TestReport]
  hasFailed: seq[TestReport]
  shownHeader: bool
  contextValues: seq[(string, TestValue)]
  skipAfterException: bool
  skipAfterManual: bool
  skipAfterCheckFail: bool
  skipNext: bool
  logger: HLogger
  Source   Edit 
TestFailKind = enum
  tfkNone, tfkException, tfkManualFail, tfkOpCheck, tfkCallCheck,
  tfkPredicateFail, tfkNoExceptionRaised, tfkUnexpectedExceptionRaised,
  tfkStrdiff, tfkStructDiff, tfkAstDiff, tfkMatchDiff, tfkStructEq,
  tfkStructNeqNoDiff
  Source   Edit 
TestReport = object
  location* {.requiresinit.}: TestLocation
  msg*: string
  case failKind*: TestFailKind
  of tfkStructDiff, tfkStructEq:
      structDiff*: It[PPrintTree]

  of tfkException, tfkUnexpectedExceptionRaised:
      exception*: ref Exception
      wanted*: seq[string]

  of tfkMatchDiff:
      paths*: seq[TestMatchFail]

  of tfkOpCheck:
      checkOp*: string

  else:
      nil

  skipped*: bool
  strs*: seq[tuple[expr: string, value: TestValue]]
  name*: string
  case kind*: TestReportKind
  of trkSectionKinds:
      conf*: TestConf
      nestedFail*: seq[TestReport]

  of trkTimeStats:
      stat*: RunningStat

  of trkTestComment, trkSuiteComment, trkBlockComment:
      text*: string

  of trkCheckOk, trkCheckFail:
      expr*: string

  else:
      nil
  Source   Edit 
TestReportKind = enum
  trkCheckpoint, trkCheckOk, trkCheckFail, trkExpectOk, trkExpectFail,
  trkTestSkip, trkTestStart, trkTestEnd, trkTestFail, trkTestOk, trkSuiteStart,
  trkSuiteEnd, trkSuiteFail, trkShow, trkBlockStart, trkBlockEnd,
  trkTestComment, trkSuiteComment, trkBlockComment, trkTimeStats, trkFileEnded,
  trkFileStarted, trkMergedFileEnded
  Source   Edit

macro show(args: varargs[untyped]): untyped
Show value in the unit test

  • WARNING :: Due to parser handling with proc arg = value case it is not possible to use show name = value without parentheses, nor is it possible to detect correctly. Instead you should either add wrapping parens (show(name = value)), or use block syntax:

    show:
    name = value

  Source   Edit
